page.title: 14LIFE STYLES 4
page.content: We met an 85 year old man in The Street. Although retired now, he had worked as a coach driver. He liked Shredded Wheat for breakfast and he gets up at 7.30 each morning. He did not like the decimalisation of our money and prefers the Â£ note to the coin. He lives in a flat but prefers detached houses. He thought that people in the village were very friendly. He has a daughter and a son who are twins. The son is a professional footballer, playing for Southend United. He also told us that he had won Â£5,400 on the football pools some time ago. We were sitting in the bus shelter with him, one of his favourite places to sit and watch. We were very pleased when he showed us some photographs of his family which he kept in his wallet.
